article.headline: Radford 66, N.C.-Asheville 65
article.story: ASHEVILLE, N.C. -- Amir Johnson scored 12 points, including a layup with 1 second left to seal Radford's 66-65 win over North Carolina-Asheville on Saturday. The Bulldogs regained the lead at 65-64 on Sean Smith's layup with 7 seconds left. But Smith didn't convert the free throw that would have sealed the three-point play, as Kenny Thomas grabbed the rebound for the Highlanders and Johnson's layup got the win. Artsiom Parakhouski led the Highlanders (15-10, 12-2 Big South Conference) with 15 points and 14 rebounds. Thomas and Joey Lynch-Flohr added 14 points apiece. J.P. Primm led the Bulldogs (12-14, 8-7) with 17 points. UNC-Asheville led by eight points at halftime, maintaining that margin in the second half on a pair of John Williams free throws that put the Bulldogs up 55-47 with 7:36 to play. The Highlanders went on a 12-6 run from that point to take the lead.

statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover
